text:
Ubuntu Budgie is an [official Ubuntu flavor](https://ubuntu.com/download/flavours) that uses the [Budgie Desktop Environment](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Budgie_\(desktop_environment\)).  As is the case with all [official Ubuntu flavors](https://ubuntu.com/download/flavours), Ubuntu Budgie has access to all of the packages in Ubuntu's repositories and can use PPAs created for Ubuntu.

[Screenshots of Ubuntu Budgie](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Ubuntu_Budgie_24.04)

## <div emoji="<:SeemsGood:478441196755091461>" style="display:none;"/> Advantages of Ubuntu Budgie
- Budgie is basically a more customizable version of GNOME.

## <div emoji="<:glare:504911469943717909>" style="display:none;"/> Disadvantages of Ubuntu Budgie
- Relatively new Ubuntu flavor and is still rough around the edges in some areas.

## <div emoji="<:think:585665071938666508>" style="display:none;"/> Should You Use Ubuntu Budgie?
If you like stock Ubuntu, but it isn't quite customizable enough for you, Ubuntu Budgie may be the distribution for you.

[Download Ubuntu Budgie](http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/ubuntu-budgie/releases/24.04/release/)

If you'd like something even lighter on system resources than Ubuntu Budgie, we recommend checking out Xubuntu (see <div emoji="`{prefix}info xubuntu`" style="display:none;"/>[Xubuntu](#xubuntu)), Ubuntu MATE (see <div emoji="`{prefix}info ubuntu mate`" style="display:none;"/>[Ubuntu MATE](#ubuntu-mate)), or Kubuntu (see <div emoji="`{prefix}info kubuntu`" style="display:none;"/>[Kubuntu](#kubuntu)).

See <div emoji="`{prefix}info ubuntu`" style="display:none;"/>[Ubuntu](#ubuntu) for more information about Ubuntu.
